storyInfo: Lancet-2 has a small problem, obtains a piece of graffiti, and perhaps a friendship as well.

attributes.content: 05:30 A.M. \ Overcast
Good evening, Doctor.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Of course, by the strictest definition, it's not evening anymore.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: You appear exhausted. My sensors indicate that you have not entered a state of deep sleep for at least twenty hours—and occasionally dozing off certainly cannot be counted.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.options: No way about it. Too many files.;...Tired.;Who made me the Doctor of Rhodes Island, huh?!

attributes.content: Your work is exceptionally important, Doctor, but it's as they say. Proper rest guarantees sustainable work.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: All members of the Medical Department see the same way on this. That is why they frequently send me to accompany you, Doctor.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Um... although, aside from daily monitoring of your physiological state, there's not much more I can do.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.options: I'm in pretty good health.;......;...Sorry for the hassle.

attributes.content: Doctor, I noticed... the mug by your right hand.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Your attempts to hide it behind the files are meaningless. Ms. Closure did not add an olfactory module to me, but my image analysis very rarely makes mistakes.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: It's still piping hot... Doctor, you poured yourself that mug in secret just now.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Fifteen minutes ago, you were already on your fourth mug, weren't you?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Occasional intake of stimulants to the central nervous system can be beneficial, but considering that it is almost morning, I suggest you... drink coffee.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: My sensors indicated just now that your heartrate is rather higher than average, as are your adrenaline levels.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Therefore... drink more coffee.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Um? What happened to me just now... Is this a slip of the tongue everyone normally makes? So robots can also have tongue slips...
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: In short, Doctor, please pay more mind to your rest, or else a Medical Department operator will lecture you again. As for your coffee... drink it.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: ...! Aaah! ......!! ...drink coffee!
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Ohh...
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: This is terrible. How could this happen to me? Doctor, can I ask that you... drink coffee?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.options: Alright. I was planning to do just that.;......;Sounds like your logic's gone kinda wrong?

attributes.content: Just where is this issue occurring...? My intent was to dissuade you, Doctor...
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Is it my logic module? Or language...
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Ohh... I've gone pathological... I can't even get something as minor as this right...
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Hey. Doctor, huh? You're up real early.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: And here I was moping about my third morning shift this week... seeing you so active, I feel a little more awake.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Anything I can help with?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.options: Lancet-2 seems to be having issues.

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Ohh... my language module's broken.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Jeez, is that right? Well, you don't see that every day.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Don't you get system checkups every week with Engineering? Last one was yesterday, wasn't it? Or was it the day before?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: You were all fine then. Closure made sure of it herself. She's the boss.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: What would cause a random malfunction?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: I do not know either... I have heard the model of robot I am typically has a ten year service lifespan.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Currently, I'm only two years, three months and five days.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Uh... no need to be so nervous?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: To tell the truth, even when we're all retired early from overwork, you should still be as youthful as ever.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Thank you for the consolation, even if I know it's only out of kindness.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: I'm nowhere near my boss's level, for sure...
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: But this one's a little too simple, isn't it?! It's just an ad-hoc silencer module. And someone did a real sloppy job of sticking it on your back. The angle's crooked, even.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: A silencer module? I have never heard of such a module.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Oh, only the old operators at Engineering would know about this. Way back when Closure was overhauling your operation platforms, your, uh, language libraries had some issues.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Ahem. Somebody carelessly input a collection of top swears from all over Terra into Castle-3.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.options: It's kind of hard to picture that.;......;You sure that was carelessness?

attributes.content: They were a little too comprehensive. We reassembled the expletive content in the processing module, and a complete deletion requires some time.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: So in the interim, we came up with these little modules. Using 'em's a cinch. Just turn it on like this, get up close, get the current flowing—
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: And any words you don't want people hearing get jammed into inaudible frequencies.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: That way, effectiveness of expression might've suffered for the time being, but at least we could avoid Castle-3 generating unnecessary complaints from certain other departments.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Put it this way: ever since then, Rhodes Island has had a lot of little kiddos aboard, haha.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Ah... Though, well... why did this module end up on me?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: I am able to guarantee that there are no words which should not exist within my language library. I ran a self-test on myself just thirty seconds ago.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Because your silencer isn't targeting any kind of swears.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Hm... seems someone entered the phrase 'do not' to the list. That checks out with what you just described, Doctor, right?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.options: Lancet-2 definitely wanted to tell me 'do not drink coffee.'

attributes.content: Yeah, hold up, I just noticed something on the back of the module... a piece of chewing gum?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Someone sneaked a module out of our place, set up new target vocab, then used gum to stick it to Lancet-2?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Real smart. Real easy mod, and one that'd sure as hell kick in. Question is, who'd do this?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Doctor, there's something I've been declining to mention.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: In the Engineering Department just earlier, I sensed the presence of a third person.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Doctor, I'm very happy that you count me along with you, but I unfortunately mean a third human.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Hah, yeah, I'm busted.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Greetings, Operator Aciddrop.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Though what I detected earlier didn't seem to be... oh, never mind. It doesn't matter.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Oh, right, your checkup today is still pending. Please wait a moment. Once I have reconfirmed the Doctor's data, I will perform your scan for you.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Additionally, please do not utilize your skateboard within living areas. It's still early, and you will be liable to disturb other operators.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: On the off-chance that a collision occurs, you may bring about further unnecessary bodily harm.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: ...Guess you're running regular again.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Doctor, I'm not sure whether my understanding is faulty, but Operator Aciddrop seems to be implying that...
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Operator Aciddrop, was it you that adhered a silencer module to me?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Yeah, I guess it was.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I did the deed.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Judging from your configuration of the silencer's targeting, do you not wish for me to direct the words 'do not' at you?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: How do I lay it out...?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I'm used to living free, see, nobody on my back. So types like you... uh, kinda jam me up a little.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Oh, am I being bothersome? I'm sorry, it's never my intent to rouse such negative emotions.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Operator Aciddrop, ever since your arrival at Rhodes Island, your condition has been gradually stabilizing.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: I'll report to Dr. Kal'tsit that we can reduce your checkup frequency.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: ...Not really what I meant.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Alright, I understand.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Operator Aciddrop, it's not checkups that you feel are bothersome, but rather myself, correct?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: This isn't a difficult problem to address.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Medical Department staff may all be very busy, but they care very much about the health and vitality of our operators, especially those of younger age who have just recently arrived. I can simply request them to assign someone else to your checkups.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.options: You sound a little hurt, Lancet-2.

attributes.content: Not at all, Doctor. Please do not mislead our new operators. I'm only a robot, after all, and would never feel any sort of grievance.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Ohh, now that I look at it, I really do tend to tell people not to do things...
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Don't say that.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: I don't wanna get someone different.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: You're good. What's wrong with robots? Robots are rad as hell, right.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Uh, it's like, how do I put it...?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: It's not like I'm saying you're annoying, even though having someone constantly up in your grill is, uh, kinda annoying, but that's 'cause you, like, care about me, right? I do get that, yeah.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: In that case, Operator Aciddrop, what bother do you mean...?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: If I have to put it some way, man, I feel like a total mess... like I kinda, uh, miss home? It's not like I MISS that whole place, but... ugh, it's a mess, yeah? It's just a freaking mess!
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I admit it! It's not even cool, is it? I know it's not cool! Say whatever you want, I don't care!
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: C'mon, why aren't you saying anything?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Every time you're like 'do not' this, 'do not' that, you make me think of someone... dunno how the hell that old geezer's doing now.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Doctor, do I sound very old?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: I only have two years of factual age, and per certain young operators' feedback, Closure selected a voice for me that should sound proximal to their ages. Does it not?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Haha, I'm not saying you're old.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: It's just how you say things sometimes.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: The old man used to really like harping on at me. Man, don't go skating there, it's dangerous. Don't be running around the block too late. Don't get too close to this or that...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: ...Made me feel like my ears were gonna start shedding.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Ah, I more or less see the picture now.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Operator Aciddrop, you feel that I'm constantly nagging.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Ohh... It really isn't a charming mannerism at all... but whenever I see you utilizing your skateboard in the corridors, I just can't help but analyze the possibility of injury.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: And within a period where your condition has not been better stabilized, excessive exercise can lead to the elevation of certain risk indicators...
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: I dig, I dig. You're looking out for us, yeah.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Honestly, it's kind of a weird feeling. Thinking about it now, like, back then it'd tick me off, and now I don't even get to hear it.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Operator Aciddrop, are you reminiscing about the past?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Reminiscing, huh... Kinda tough to say I am, I guess. It ends up kinda lame, y'know, always thinking about the past and whatever.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Hey. Rhodes Island's a pretty solid place. It's got radical robots like you, too. Haha.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Um, are you apologizing to me, Operator Aciddrop?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: I'll try to stop skating in some places. That's what you want, right?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I was just kinda talking crap yesterday, and E... uh, said there was something real fun I could try playing with.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: At first I didn't actually think it'd work, and then when I heard you telling me in your normal voice to go to bed too late, it felt... a little awkward, deep down. Super awkward.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: It was pretty wack. I mean, freedom is freedom... but I didn't feel any more relaxed. Actually just felt even more messed up.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Basically, I was wrong to do this.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: And now you've busted me. What's my sentence? Do I get detention?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Oh, Rhodes Island has no custom of arbitrary detention. Besides, this isn't that big of a problem, is it?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Operator Aciddrop, in your hometown, convenient modification of otherwise inconvenient machines was quite a common sight, wasn't it?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: I've seen it in your files. Both your hand crossbow and your skateboard have been through a certain degree of modification.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: No, that's twisted.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: You're not that kinda machine.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.options: As in, you're more than an ordinary machine.;I'm guessing she sees Lancet-2 as a friend?

attributes.content: Then that's all the less to worry about. As I view it, it's only a tiny, harmless prank.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Does it count as a prank?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: A practical joke between friends conducted with mutual understanding. In my judgment, this meets the definition of a prank. Of course, robots cannot actually understand any sort of comedy.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Doctor, what do you think?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: As you see, even the Doctor laughed. This proves that it truly is a prank, correct?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: As it is a prank, I believe Dr. Kal'tsit and Amiya won't need to know about this. As of now, I have already resumed normal operation, and the Engineering Department will not save any files or data on an issue as minor as this.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Huh. Thanks.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: You really are a—super-rad—friend.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: 'Kay. See ya 'round.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Er, please don't utilize your skateboard in the corridors—
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Doctor, I have a question.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Do you also believe me to be a nag?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.options: Not at all. You're right to say what you do.;Just the tiniest little bit.

attributes.content: Whenever you particularly want to drink coffee, I always advise against your continued consumption of it. Hearing it constantly does tend to be a bother, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Compared to one that always says 'do not,' I'm sure you'd much prefer a robot at your side that automatically serves you coffee when you want it—that would be far more obedient of a machine.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: In that case, I ought to seek out Closure to decrease the frequency at which I say 'do not,' shouldn't I?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: But that would be mutually incompatible with my intended purpose.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: I am a medical robot. My purpose lies in ensuring the robust health of everyone at Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: And what I speak, you don't always listen to. It goes for Closure, too. She's just like you, Doctor. Constant overtime work, and an unhealthy diet.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: If my nagging was undesirable, I wouldn't have been designed with this function, would I?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Ohhh... I don't understand... There's a contradiction in logic here.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.options: It's not a contradiction.;......;It's because that's who you are, Lancet-2.

attributes.content: Is it not contradictory? This is just me? My nagging self?
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: If any of you don't like it, you can always change these behavioral habits of mine.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.options: I don't want you to change.;Closure doesn't want you to change.;Not even Aciddrop wants you to change.

attributes.content: Alright. Maybe I don't understand your meaning at all, Doctor. But it's likely you're comforting me, so thank you.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Hi, Doctor. Nice to see you again.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Good morning.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: I see you rested at the appropriate time last night, and that is truly wonderful.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Doctor, are you here to observe Operator Aciddrop's training too? This is the first time she's taken part in morning drills. Oh, and Operators Ethan and Vigna are also training alongside her.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Not that I know why, but I feel today's instructors are especially strict. The rate at which I consume disinfectant fluid has risen dramatically.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Huff... pff...
attributes.name: Ethan

attributes.content: You all monsters or something?! How the hell do you see me here?!
attributes.name: Ethan

attributes.content: Rhodes Island training is this tough, huh...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Even I'm...
attributes.name: Vigna

attributes.content: I'm serious, did either of you do something wild and get caught?!
attributes.name: Vigna

attributes.content: So full of energy.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: It seems as if their excess activity actually works to their benefit... Perhaps I really am able to lower my frequency of 'do not' now.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Lancet-2, something's on your back.
attributes.name: Melantha

attributes.content: Um... um?!
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: It's bright green, a very pretty color. Um, I think it's graffiti.
attributes.name: Melantha

attributes.content: Graffiti, is it...? How fortunate it's not anything else. I do worry about having issues crop up again.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Come to mention it, I wonder what this means... let's scan and see.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: Hm? It's Columbian slang? My language library has no phrases that match it.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.options: You might call them words of praise.;......;A prank between friends, you could say.

attributes.content: Are they really kind words? I'm not too certain...
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: But in any case, they're quite pretty, aren't they? And Miss Melantha said so too.
attributes.name: Lancet-2

attributes.content: So, for the time being, I'll accept them.
attributes.name: Lancet-2
